description: Part single and two storey side and rear extensions, roof extensions and alterations to the office building on south side of yard to form 1 x 5 bedroom detached dwellinghouse, together with the construction of 9 x 3 storey dwellinghouses (7 x 5 bedroom and 2 x 4 bedroom) and the formation of vehicular access from Poplar Avenue, and a gated pedestrian access to the Canal towpath, an internal access road, landscaping and erection of fencing, railings and walls and erection of detached wash/shower room adjacent to towpath to be used as a sanitary facility (Following the demolition and removal of workshop building, portable buildings, structures and tank within the yard, and part single and two storey side and rear extensions to office building)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | The development authorised by this permission shall not begin until the local planning authority has approved in writing a full scheme of works for improvement to: (i)	The private access road to the east of the application site identified on drawing L2694010C (Site Plan Proposed). These works shall include the construction of a pedestrian footpath and kerbs between the adjacent canal bridge and the access to the site. The development shall not be first occupied until those works have been fully completed in accordance with the local planning authority's approval and have been certified in writing as complete by the local planning authority. The completed works shall be retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for pedestrian access between the bridge and Poplar Avenue in the interests of pedestrian movement and highway safety in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.4, 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004). | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  The development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.   Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.6, 4.8 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'New Plan for the Environment'. | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing to the Local Planning Authority layout and elevation plans indicating the positions, appearance, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details, which shall be completed before the residential units are first occupied and permanently retained thereafter.  Reason  To protect the appearance of the area and the amenity of surrounding properties in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.6, 4.8 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'New Plan for the Environment'. | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted plans details of hard and soft landscaping works, tree retention and protection, tree removal, replacement tree planting and a phased programme of works shall be submitted to and approved in writing to the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. Hard and soft landscaping works, tree retention and protection, tree removal and tree replacement shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the development, or in accordance with the programme of works agreed in writing with the local planning authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. Any tree removal or pruning shall not take place in the bird-nesting season (March to September), and a detailed inspection of trees shall be undertaken before any felling/pruning to ensure that no bat roosts are overlooked. If bats are found Natural England will need to be contacted for a license. The details submitted with this condition shall consider the retention of trees 7, 8, 11, 12, 18, 19, and G21 as shown on the submitted Tree Survey Plan (L2694/SK045). Any trees felled on the site shall be replaced at a ratio of 1:1.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 3.8, 4.1, 4.5, 4.6, 4.8 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004); Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 9: Trees and Development Guidelines. | The car parking spaces shown on the approved plans shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.	  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking  within the site, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of sound attenuation measures from traffic and aircraft noise together with any associated ventilation for the proposed residential units shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any of the residential units and thereafter permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 10: Noise and Vibration. | Before the development is commenced, details of a tree protection method statement setting out the measures to ensure full protection of all trees to be retained within the site to BS 5837: 2001 and means of constructing the buildings and associated overground and underground services, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall thereafter be carried out only in accordance with the approved method statement, which shall apply until the end of the construction period.  Reason: To prevent damage to the retained trees in the interest of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 3.8, 4.1, 4.5 and 4.8 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 : Trees and Development guidelines. | The development hereby authorised shall comply with 'The aims and objectives of the Police requirements of Secured By Design.'  Reason: In the interests of crime prevention and the safety and security of users of the site, in accordance with policy 4.4 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 8: Safer Ealing. | There shall be no obstruction above 0.6m in height at any time within pedestrian visibility splay areas at the back line of the footway / access road that measure 1.5m deep and 1.5m wide at either side of the vehicular access point to the site. The new access shall be constructed before any part of the development permitted is first occupied and the pedestrian visibility splays shall be permanently retained in the form described in this condition, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: In the interests of highway safety in accordance with policies 4.1, 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | All of the alleviation measures detailed in the submitted Geotechnical and Geoenvironmental survey submitted with the application - Geotechnical and Geoenvironmental Report Reference 35361-002 (December 2006) shall be implemented on the site in accordance with a programme and schedule of works to be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development. Once implemented any alleviation measures shall be retained thereafter for the lifetime of the development, unless otherwise stated in the approved programme of works or otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To protect the future living conditions of residents and nearby properties in accordance policies 2.7 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) | A BS: 4142 industrial noise assessment including details protecting the dwellings from external industrial noise sources from the adjacent car repair site including noise mitigation measures with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced. The works shall be carried out as approved before first occupation and shall thereafter be retained.  Reason: In the interests of the amenity of future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10: Noise and Vibration. | Prior to the commencement of any development on site a site drainage scheme shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved drainage scheme shall be implemented on the site prior to the first occupation of any part of the development, and retained thereafter unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure that adequate drainage of the site is carried out as approved, in accordance with policies 2.1 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards, and one residential unit shall be constructed to wheelchair housing standards, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of development.  The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure access for all future occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7: Accessible Ealing. | On-site renewable energy production technology, energy efficient design and sustainable construction which would deliver at least 10% of the predicted baseline energy demand shall be installed at the site prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved and shall be permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwsie agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure the proposal contributes to its renewable energy and climate change requirements in accordance with policy 2.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment) 2004. | Prior to the commencement of the development on the site, details of a site construction method statement and management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The method statement/management plan shall include the following:+	details of foundation type and a foundation method statement considering the structural impact on the adjacent canal bridge +	on-site construction worker parking+	anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site+	delivery times (staggered to avoid morning and afternoon school run peak periods)+	dust suppression measures+	wheel washing provisions+	site security+	vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including sweep path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear.+	details as to the locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors offices+	procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.Such details shall be implemented, or phasing agreed in writing, prior to the commencement of works on site and thereafter retained for the duration of the works.  Reason:  To ensure appropriate mitigation measures to protect the amenity of local residents and occupiers of the neighbouring sites, to ensure adequate highway and site safety and to prevent damage to surrounding buildings and structures, in accordance with policies 4.4, 4.5, 4.6, 4.7, 4.8,  4.11, 9.1 and 9.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment) 2004. | All of the ecological measures detailed in the ecological surveys submitted with the application - Phase 1 Habitat Survey Reference: H20URB-NORYAR-1462 (March 2008), and Ecological Enhancement Strategy Reference: H20URB-NORYAR-1462 (March 2008) shall be implemented on the site in accordance with a programme and schedule of works to be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development. Once implemented any ecological measures shall be retained thereafter for the lifetime of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: In the interests of nature conservation and habitat protection and enhancement in accordance with policies 3.8 and 3.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | All of the archaeological mitigation measures detailed in the archaeological desktop assessment submitted with the application - Archaeological Desktop Assessment (June 2007) shall be implemented on the site in accordance with a programme and schedule of works to be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development. Once implemented any archaeological mitigation measures shall be retained thereafter for the lifetime of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To safeguard and record any archaeological remains present at the site in accordance with policy 4.9 in the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 2004 'Plan for the Environment' and the provisions of Planning Policy Guidance 16 'Archaeology and Planning'. | The following trees and hedges within the site G9, 12, 13, 17, 18, 22, 23, 24, 25, G30, 31, 32, 33, 34, G35  as shown on the submitted Tree Survey Plan (L2694/SK045) , shall not be lopped, topped, felled or otherwise affected in any way (including raising or lowering soil levels under the crown spread of the trees) and no excavation shall be cut under the crown spread of those trees without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason - In order to safeguard trees and other vegetation in the interests of the visual amenity of the area in accordance with policies 3.8, 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9: Trees and Development Guidelines. | A bat survey and appropriate mitigation measures shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details including the implementation of mitigation measures, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure that the ecological habitat of the site is protected and enhanced in accordance with polices 3.8, 3.9 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | A reptile survey and appropriate mitigation measures shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details including the implementation of mitigation measures, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure that the ecological habitat of the site is protected and enhanced in accordance with polices 3.8, 3.9 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A & B of the Schedule of Part 1 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2008,  no enlargement, improvement or other alteration including roof alteration to the dwellings hereby permitted shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the dwellings hereby approved, in accordance with policies 4.1,  4.8 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of any external lighting shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of development.  The lighting as approved shall be installed prior to the first occupation of any part of the development and maintained in accordance with the approved standards thereafter.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, the visual appearance of the area and the wildlife within adjacent views of open space in accordance with policies 3.8, 3.9, 4.1, 4.4,  4.8, 4.12 and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' 2004. | Prior to the commencement of any development, details of a raised area (highway table) across the vehicular access point into the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved works shall be implemented on the site prior to the first occupation of any part of the development, and retained thereafter unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority   Reason: In the interests of highway and particulartly pedestrian safety in accordance with policies 4.1, 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
